page.title: 15TRANSPORT IN FRILSHAM
page.content: If you live in Frilsham it is essential to have a{bicycle or a car} or to know a friendly car owner. There is{one bus}which runs on Thursday from the telephone box at Frilsham to Newbury staying in town for 2 hours. On this bus there is a voluntary "welcome aboard" scheme to help the elderly.{No trains.}The{M4 motorway } forms the northern boundary of the area and there is no access from Frilsham. The two{main roads}run N-S and E-W. They cross at the village of Frilsham. These are unclassified roads. Other{minor roads}run between the large houses and the farms which were once estate roads and now maintained by Newbury District Council. They are narrow but cars can pass. Severe winter conditions in 1985 made these roads impassable and villages were cut off for a few days.
